title: Ticket #2880: Allow setting DMTCP checkpoint interval via environment
description:
From Michael Hanke:

please consider the attached patch against shim_dmtcp. It adds a help snippet for the --ckpint option and also makes it use the corresponding DMTCP env variable as a default (if available). I think this patch makes all involved parts be nicer to each other and a user. Moreover, it allows for simplifying this 

  executable = /usr/lib/condor/shim_dmtcp
  arguments = --ckptint 300 some_command some_arg1 some_arg2

to 

  environment = DMTCP_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL=300;...
  executable = /usr/lib/condor/shim_dmtcp
  arguments = some_command some_arg1 some_arg2

which is nice as it separates shim script args and payload args for one of the most frequently used options -- especially useful for multi-job clusters with varying arguments.
